articles.author: Steven Scheer, Yomna Ehab
articles.description: Hezbollah rockets hit Israel's third-largest city of Haifa, police said early on Monday, and Israeli media reported 10 injured in the country's north on the first anniversary of the Gaza war, which has spread in the Middle East.
articles.title: Hezbollah strikes Israel on Gaza war anniversary; fears grow over Middle East instability

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Ahmed Jadallah, Andrew Mills
articles.description: Hamas leader-in-exile Khaled Meshaal said the Palestinian group would rise "like a phoenix" from the ashes despite heavy losses during a year of war with Israel, and that it continues to recruit fighters and manufacture weapons.
articles.title: Exclusive: Hamas will rise 'like a phoenix' from the ashes, leader-in-exile says

articles.author: Oleksandr Kozhukhar, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian forces have entered the outskirts of the eastern Ukraine frontline city of Toretsk, Ukraine's military said late on Monday, less than a week after the fall of the nearby bastion town of Vuhledar.
articles.title: Russian forces reach another key frontline city, Ukraine's military says

articles.author: Cassandra Garrison, Diego Oré
articles.description: The backdrop of high-profile violence has shocked the country.
articles.title: On eve of Sheinbaum's new security policy, Mexico reels from latest attacks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Albanian police fired tear gas to disperse opposition protesters who hurled petrol bombs at government buildings and smashed city property in what they said was part of a civil disobedience against the government.
articles.title: Albania's police fire teargas to disperse protesters hurling petrol bombs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of a rotating presidency that is running Haiti said on Monday that he would not ratify the handover to the man in line to take over from him, citing unresolved corruption accusations against three other council members.
articles.title: Haiti's divided transition council in dispute over new president

articles.author: Sakshi Dayal
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) trailed in two provincial elections as votes were counted on Tuesday, TV channels said, a fresh setback after it failed to win a clear majority in the general election this year.
articles.title: India PM Modi's BJP trails in vote count in two provincial elections, TV says

articles.author: Niklas Pollard, Ludwig Burger
articles.description: U.S. scientists Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun won the 2024 Nobel Prize in Medicine for the discovery of microRNA and its crucial role in how multicellular organisms grow and live, the award-giving body said on Monday.
articles.title: Nobel prize for medicine: US duo Ambros and Ruvkun win for work on microRNA

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam and France have officially upgraded their relations to a "comprehensive strategic partnership", Vietnam's highest level, during a visit by Vietnamese President To Lam to Paris.
articles.title: Vietnam upgrades ties with France to highest level

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Preliminary results showed President Kais Saied won a second term in the Tunisian election with 90.69% of the vote, the electoral commission said on Monday.
articles.title: Tunisian President Saied secures a second term with more than 90% of vote
